text: Prince Antoine of Bourbon-Two Sicilies (;de Badts de Cugnac, Chantal. Coutant de Saisseval, Guy. Le Petit Gotha. Nouvelle Imprimerie Laballery, Paris 2002, p. 562-563 (French) 20 January 1929- 11 November 2019https://constantinianorder.net/hrh-prince-antoine-of-bourbon-two-sicilies- demise/?lang=en) was a member of the House of Bourbon-Two Sicilies which ruled the defunct Kingdom of the Two Sicilies until 1860. He was an engineer who worked in radar technology.Montgomery-Massingberd, Hugh. "Burke’s Royal Families of the World: Volume I Europe & Latin America, 1977, pp. 533. ==Titles, styles, honours and arms== ===Titles and styles=== *20 January 1929 – 11 November 2019: His Highness Prince Antoine of Bourbon-Two SiciliesVelde, Francois. Heraldica.org. The style of Infante/Infanta de España. Decrees Concerning the Style of Infante de España, 1765–1920. retrieved 25 September 2011. ===Honours=== *Bailiff Grand Cross of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of Saint George *Knight of Honor and Devotion of the Sovereign Military Order of Malta ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2019 deaths Category:French princes
title: Prince Antoine of Bourbon-Two Sicilies
